DataElement.preferredName: Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria Plan Study Activity Discontinued Ability Flag ISO21090.BL.v1.0
DataElement.preferredDefinition: An activity that is intended to occur at some point in the context of a particular study that represents a characteristic or requirement intended to be applied to a potential study subject to determine whether or not they may participate in a study. NOTE(S): This allows questions defined as agnostic criteria in defined eligibility criterion (that is, they could be used either as inclusion or exclusion criteria) to be referenced in specific study protocols and allows the inclusion/exclusion distinction to be determined for that study specifically. Specifies whether the planned activity is interruptable by asynchronous events. NOTE(S): This may only be useful for planned subject activity groups or administrative activities.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria Plan Study Activity Discontinued Ability Flag
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.:To devise, contrive, or form in design.:A detailed examination, analysis, or critical inspection of a subject designed to discover facts about it.:An active process; excludes processes and mechanisms which fulfill biological functions._To stop or end, permanently or temporarily.:The quality of being able to perform; a quality that permits or facilitates achievement or accomplishment .:An indicator that can be set or unset in order to signal whether a particular condition is true.

ObjectClass.preferredName: Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria Plan Study Activity

The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.:To devise, contrive, or form in design.:A detailed examination, analysis, or critical inspection of a subject designed to discover facts about it.:An active process; excludes processes and mechanisms which fulfill biological functions.

Concepts.definition: Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.
To devise, contrive, or form in design.
A detailed examination, analysis, or critical inspection of a subject designed to discover facts about it.
An active process; excludes processes and mechanisms which fulfill biological functions.

Property.preferredDefinition: To stop or end, permanently or temporarily.:The quality of being able to perform; a quality that permits or facilitates achievement or accomplishment .:An indicator that can be set or unset in order to signal whether a particular condition is true.

Concepts.definition: To stop or end, permanently or temporarily.
The quality of being able to perform; a quality that permits or facilitates achievement or accomplishment.
An indicator that can be set or unset in order to signal whether a particular condition is true.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Default Conceptual Domain for UML Loader
Health Informatics - Harmonized data types for information interchange

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation. Indicators determine or aid in determining whether or not certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied. (On-line Medical Dictionary)

Concepts.definition: An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.
